title: Top 5 Security Tips for Cape Town Residents
excerpt: Crime trends in Cape Town are changing. Here are the top 5 things you can do today to secure your home, from lighting to perimeter beams.

content.text: Living in Cape Town requires a proactive approach to security. It's not just about having an alarm; it's about layering your defenses to deter criminals before they even reach your door.
Criminals hate light. Installing motion-sensor floodlights around your property is one of the most cost-effective deterrents available. Ensure there are no dark corners for intruders to hide in.
With frequent load shedding, your alarm battery takes a beating. If it's older than 18 months, it likely won't last through a 4-hour outage. Test it regularly or upgrade to Lithium-Ion.
Overgrown bushes near your electric fence or driveway provide perfect cover for ambush. Keep your garden neat and ensure your perimeter fence is free of foliage that causes false alarms.
Make sure your alarm company board is visible and your house number is clear. In an emergency, every second counts for the response vehicle to find you.
A strong neighborhood watch is better than any tech. Join your local WhatsApp group and look out for each other.

title: Understanding Regulations for Electric Fencing in South Africa
excerpt: Did you know that non-compliant electric fencing can void your insurance? Learn about the COC requirements and safety laws.

content.text: Electric fencing is a popular deterrent in South Africa, but it strictly regulated by the Department of Labour. Installing a non-compliant fence is not only illegal but can leave you liable for injuries.

A Certificate of Compliance (COC) acts as a guarantee that your electric fence installation complies with the Occupational Health and Safety Act. Without this document, your insurance company may reject a burglary claim.

items: Fences must be marked with yellow warning signs every 10 meters.
The fence must not be electrified within 1.5m of the ground unless it's behind a physical barrier.
Energizers must be installed in a safe, accessible location.
Earth spikes must be installed at specific intervals.
